409: Putting People First in Pharmacy- Navitus was founded as an alternative to traditional pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) models. We are committed to removing cost from the drug supply chain to make medications more affordable for the people who need them. At Navitus, our team members work in an environment that celebrates diversity, fosters creativity and encourages growth. We welcome new ideas and share a passion for excellent service to our customers and each other. The EPMO Program Manager is responsible for working with business leaders to identify and define enterprise-level programs, strategies and plans to align with organizational goals. Overseeing development of business benefits and program cost proposals, the EPMO Program Manager provides direction and facilitation expertise to ensure management decision-making for optimal return on investment. This individual coordinates with various departments and vendors to achieve and maintain effective administration of assigned programs and help meet organizational goals. Is this you? Find out more below! How do I make an impact on my team? Provide expertise and leadership to identify, prioritize, and select key program initiatives. Define scope and align with organizational goals to produce business benefits and outcomes; establish metrics to monitor performance. Estimate resources and participants needed to achieve program goals. Where required, work with department managers to negotiate the acquisition of required personnel from within the company. Determine and assess need for additional staff and/or consultants. Make recommendations for recruitments to support program outcomes. Ensure program support through governance and oversight. Responsible for communicating with and presenting to internal and external members of executive team, and vendors, as necessary. Communication and presentations will be related to significant initiatives, timelines, financials, status reports, etc. Liaise across various departments on assigned programs, ensuring effective integration and communication. Create awareness of, and urgency around the need for change. Model behavior and communicate change in a way that drives acceptance and ownership by stakeholders and removes barriers to successful and sustainable implementation. Develop and implement processes to mentor project managers, team members and Navitus leaders to develop and grow an understanding of Navitus project, program and portfolio management methodologies. Provide leadership and best practices in related techniques and methods. Provide leadership in methodologies including, but not limited to, Waterfall, Iterative, Agile, Lean Six Sigma. Promote the application of various methodologies and best practices within project management and product teams. Facilitate processes to promote innovation, continuous improvement, and best practices within the EPMO and to related areas within the organization for project management. Research and implement ideas and innovative approaches to enhances processes within Navitus. Actively maintain team policy and procedure documentation. What our team expects from you? Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in business, finance, program management or related field, with ten (10) years equivalent work experience Six (6) years relevant work (8-12 years preferred) managing complex, high-risk and high-visibility projects. Proven experience executing successful project management standards with a complex organization and/or various IT domains (infrastructure, Dev/Ops, cybersecurity, etc.) Three or more years program management experience. Demonstrates experience developing business case, roadmaps, and program metrics Strong knowledge of Excel and experience with project and portfolio management platforms is required Experience working within an Enterprise PMO, facilitating governance processes, and oversight / steering committee Health insurance or pharmacy benefits management industry experience is preferred. Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or similar project management certification which provides the same functional project management training and practice standards Program Management Professional (PgMP) is desirable Agile certifications are highly desirable Organizational change management certifications (e.g., ADKAR®, CCMP) desirable Participate in, adhere to, and support compliance program objectives The ability to consistently interact cooperatively and respectfully with other employees What can you expect from Navitus? Hours/Location: Monday – Friday: 8:00am-5:00pm, Remote Paid Volunteer Hours Educational Assistance Plan and Professional Membership assistance Referral Bonus Program – up to $750! Top of the industry benefits for Health, Dental, and Vision insurance, Flexible Spending Account, Paid Time Off, Eight paid holidays, 401K, Short-term and Long-term disability, College Savings Plan, Paid Parental Leave, Adoption Assistance Program, and Employee Assistance Program
